title: Using machine learning to downscale coarse-resolution environmental variables for understanding the spatial frequency of convective storms
summary: Global climate models (GCMs), typically run at ~100-km resolution, capture large-scale environmental conditions but cannot resolve convection and cloud processes at kilometer scales. Convection-permitting models offer higher-resolution simulations that explicitly simulate convection but are computationally expensive and impractical for large ensemble runs.
